page.title: 19CASTLE - CROOKSTON ,GLASGOW
page.content:
At Brockburn Road in the middle of the Pollok housing scheme stands the ruin of Crookston Castle, one of the oldest fortified buildings in the country. The lst castle was wooden and was built by Sir Robert De Croc in the (12th, it was rebuilt in the (l5th by Sir Alex. Stewart. Another owner was Darnley the lst, and he took part in the uprising against James IV. In l488 the king led an attack on the castle with Mons Meg (cannon). The castle surrendered in under l day.
Legend says that Mary Queen of Scots and Lord Darnley stayed in Crookston Castle and that she watched the Battle of Langside from the Castle but there is no evidence to prove this.
